DataElement.preferredName: Blast Phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia Occurrence Disease or Disorder Phase Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of chronic myelogenous leukemia blast phases that occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blast Phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An advanced phase of chronic myelogenous leukemia.  It is characterized a. by the presence of blasts in the peripheral blood or bone marrow that are at least 20% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow respectively, or b. an extramedullary proliferation of blasts, and/or c. when there are large aggregates and clusters of blasts in the bone marrow biopsy specimen (adapted from WHO, 2001)._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An advanced phase of chronic myelogenous leukemia.  It is characterized a. by the presence of blasts in the peripheral blood or bone marrow that are at least 20% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow respectively, or b. an extramedullary proliferation of blasts, and/or c. when there are large aggregates and clusters of blasts in the bone marrow biopsy specimen (adapted from WHO, 2001).

Concepts.longName: Blast Phase Chronic Myeloid Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Positive
Concepts.definition: An advanced phase of chronic myeloid leukemia.  It is characterized by: 1.  the presence of blasts in the peripheral blood or bone marrow that are at least 20% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow respectively, or 2. an extramedullary proliferation of blasts, and/or 3. when there are large aggregates and clusters of blasts in the bone marrow biopsy specimen (adapted from WHO, 2001).

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Three

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Three
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Phase; any distinct time period in a sequence of events:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A distinguishable part, a stage in a series of events or in a process of development, e.g. any of the varying aspects or stages in course of a disease; a fraction of a cycle.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
